body:
**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

we use a CHECK constraint for ENUM.  I have no idea what you'd want here, except in-Python validation?   I'd call this a feature then?  add a flag "python_validation=True" to ENUM, how's that?  Since I can't imagine how a CHECK could do this?

**Changes by Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)):**

* removed labels: **orm**
* added labels: **postgres**

**Changes by Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)):**

* changed **milestone** from "0.9.5" to "0.9.xx"

**rachidb ([@rach](https://github.com/rach)) wrote:**

I was expecting the insert to fail, it seems like no CHECK constraint was added on the array content. To be honest, I don't know if this allowed.

I initially tried native ENUM but the schema creation fail:

     sqlalchemy.exc.CompileError: Postgresql ENUM type requires a name. 

I just tried "python_validation=True" but this raise and error:

    TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'python_validation'

I also cannot see it in the doc : http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/core/types.html#sqlalchemy.types.Enum
Is it in something recent.

I will try to add a `@validate` to check the item inserted in the ARRAY , not a big deal that ENUM didn't work but as it didn't complain then I though it will be working.

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

> I just tried "python_validation=True" but this raise and error:

I am suggesting this as a potential new feature.

Right now, ENUM creates a CHAR() plus a CHECK constraint for the values in that CHAR.  I don't know how this could be acheived inside of a Postgresql ARRAY.

**rachidb ([@rach](https://github.com/rach)) wrote:**

Sorry I misunderstood. 
It could be useful to have Enum with python validation as it often a pain to migrate.
Thanks for your answers.

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

the work here is:

1. add flag `python_validation=True` to sqltypes.Enum

2. add a bind processor that takes effect when this flag is enabled

3. document the flag in the docstring

4. add tests to test/sql/test_types.py

5. changelog message in changelog_XX , depending on which version we're at

**Changes by Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)):**

* changed **milestone** from "0.9.xx" to "1.0.xx"

**Changes by Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)):**

* changed **milestone** from "1.0.xx" to "1.x.xx"

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

see https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/pull-requests/72/support-native-enum/diff where we might just add validation in all cases for 1.1

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

- add changelog and migration notes for new Enum features,
fixes #3095, #3292
- reorganize enum constructor to again work with the MySQL
ENUM type
- add a new create_constraint flag to Enum to complement that of
Boolean
- reinstate the CHECK constraint tests for enum, these already
fail /skip against the MySQL backend
- simplify lookup rules in Enum, have them apply to all varieties
of Enum equally


â†’ df55695f8e99

**Changes by Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)):**

* changed **status** to closed

**Michael Bayer ([@zzzeek](https://github.com/zzzeek)) wrote:**

regression: a SQL expression that concatenates to the ENUM maintains the type ENUM which then fails because the value isn't in the list.   totally not-tested use case.

issue.title: Support native Python 3.4 enums with enum type
issue.body:
**Migrated issue, originally created by Veeti Paananen ([@veeti](https://github.com/veeti))**

It would be nice to have built-in integration between the SQLAlchemy enum type and standard Python enums.

issue.title: Query db.Enum with LIKE filter
issue.body:
**Migrated issue, originally created by Leonid Umanskiy**

Hi,
I am trying to implement the search functionality over different columns, including Enum.
However, when I do:

```
db.session.query(info_models.ItemProperty).filter(info_models.ItemProperty.grade.like('%'+search_query+'%')).all()
```

I get an error:

```
(builtins.LookupError) "%test%" is not among the defined enum values [SQL: '...' ]

```

The SQL provided runs fine. I am not sure about other database engines, but MySQL supports "LIKE" queries and it's native Enums just fine. I know I can find a work around by comparing the search query with the enum options first, and then include ones that match, but this is dirty and I rather use the functionality that MySQL provides.
